question: In the analysis of III group basic radicals of salts, the purpose of adding NH₄Cl(s) to NH₄OH is:
choices: To increase the concentration of OH⁻ ions.
To precipitate the radicals of group IV and V.
To suppress the dissociation of NH₄OH.
explanation: This works on the common ion effect.
NH₄Cl provides NH₄⁺ ions, which suppresses the ionization of the weak base NH₄OH.

This lowers the [OH⁻] concentration, ensuring only Group III hydroxides (like Al(OH)₃, Fe(OH)₃, Cr(OH)₃) precipitate, as they have very low solubility products (Ksp). Group IV/V hydroxides require higher [OH⁻] to precipitate.
